text: Brickellia problematica is a Mexican species of flowering plants in the daisy family. It is native to western Mexico in the states of Puebla and Oaxaca.Turner, B. L. 1997. The Comps of Mexico: A systematic account of the family Asteraceae, vol. 1 – Eupatorieae. Phytologia Memoirs 11: i–iv, 1–272Brandegee, Townshend Stith 1908. Zoë 5: 262 as Barroetea glutinosa ==References== problematica Category:Endemic flora of Mexico Category:Flora of Puebla Category:Flora of Oaxaca Category:Plants described in 1908 Category:Taxa named by Townshend Stith Brandegee
title: Brickellia problematica
